meanings.definition: Consisting of or divided into episodes.
meanings.sent1: The TV show had an episodic structure with each episode focusing on a different character.
meanings.sent2: Her storytelling style was episodic, jumping from one event to another without a clear timeline.
meanings.sent3: The episodic nature of the novel kept readers engaged as they eagerly awaited each new chapter.
meanings.sent4: His memory was like an episodic series, each event a separate episode waiting to be replayed.
meanings.sent5: The episodic format of the podcast made it easy to listen to short segments on the go.

meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling an episode.
meanings.sent1: The play had an episodic feel, with each scene presenting a different aspect of the character's life.
meanings.sent2: Her dreams were often episodic, like short stories playing out in her mind.
meanings.sent3: The episodic nature of the conversation made it feel like a series of mini-dramas unfolding.
meanings.sent4: His life seemed to be an episodic adventure, with unexpected twists at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The episodic structure of the movie allowed for multiple storylines to intersect seamlessly.

meanings.sent1: The episodic rainfall in the desert brought temporary relief to the dry land.
meanings.sent2: Her episodic visits to the old bookstore always brought back fond memories.
meanings.sent3: The episodic appearance of fireflies in the garden added a magical touch to the summer nights.
meanings.sent4: His episodic laughter echoed through the room, breaking the solemn silence.
meanings.sent5: The episodic chirping of the birds signaled the changing seasons in the forest.
